answers.answer: could the timing of the iritation and the new glasses simply be unrelated?If you think along that line...what could cause eye irritation?(infection)  ( viral or bacterial?)Feeling of eyelid pressuring eye....(neurological impairment causing false sensation)Tingling in the back of head as well....(involvement of nerves, definitely)does she have any other medical problems? diabetes? history of shingles?Tests.....blood tests?, tests of nerve function, tests of muscle function...medications..... ones tto treat viral infections, bacterial infections, nerve pain(nerve pain includes tingling), post-herpetic(shingles) nerve pain, diabetic nerve pain...go...learn....research online....learn what to ask your mom so you can tell the doctor the right information and get the right diagnosis and treatment.

question: My mom has been feeling this tingling sensation in the back of her head for almost four months now.  It all started when she got a new prescription for her glasses from Taiwan, and it caused her left eye to be irritated.  She later went to another optometrist and got the correct prescription.  However, it did not elevate the problem.  She still feels uncomfortable with her left eye and the same tingling sensation in the back of her head.    She claims that she can feel her eyelid was pressuring her eye while she was sleeping.  Her family doctor has prescribed some migraine medicine for her to intake but it does not seem to help the condition.  Is this a sign of migraine?
title: Tingling in the back of head
